title: How to pay property tax in Mumbai
text:
How to pay property tax in Mumbai How to pay property tax in Mumbai Like this story, share it with millions of investors on M3 How to pay property tax in Mumbai How to pay property tax in Mumbai Post your opinion here 
P roperty owners in Mumbai will pay an increase of an average of 14.52% as property tax from April this year, as per the BMC’s standing committee resolution. However, under the new rules those who own flats that measure less than 500 sq ft, who would otherwise have paid more under these new rules, will not pay the increase since they have been granted relief by the Chief Minister. There will be no increase for this section for a period of 5 years. This is reported to benefit around 17 lakh families who live in houses with an area of less than 500 square feet. 
How is the property tax calculated under the new rules? 
The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has changed the property tax calculation from the earlier Rateable Value System (RVS) to the new Capital Value System (CVS). Under the RVS, the tax was calculated based on the maximum amount of rent that the property could fetch in a year. The CVS is based on the market value of the property. 
Capital value is calculated as follows: 
Market value of property (X) total carpet area (X) weight for construction type (X) weight for age of building 
Use the Ready Reckoner (RR) to arrive at market value. RR is a compilation of the rates that denote a fair value price for a property set by the state government. The builder may charge a premium over such rates but cannot under sell it. The RR gives the base value and the stamp duty and registration amount payable cannot be lower than these rates. Check the ward / zone in which your property falls. 
Weights for construction type are calculated in units and are as follows; 
Bungalows & RCC construction 1 unitOther than RCC (semi-permanent / chawls) -0 .60 unitUnder construction or vacant land 0.50 unitWeights for age of building are calculated in units and are as follows: 
Properties constructed before 1945 0.80 unitProperties constructed between 1945 and 1985 0.90 unitProperties constructed after 1985 1 unitProperty tax calculation would be: 
Capital value of property (X) current property tax (X) weight for user category 
Weights for user category are calculated in units and are as follows: 
Hotels and like businesses 4 unitsCommercial properties (shops, offices) 3 unitsIndustries & factories 2 unitsResidential & charitable institutions 1 unitWhere can you pay the property tax? 
The property tax can be paid at the Office of the Assistant Revenue Officer or at the BMC Help Centers or at the Citizen Facilitation Centre at all the Ward Offices. Online payments are also possible. Visit the BMC website: http://cvs.mcgm.gov.in:7001/MCGM_CVS/ 
How to make online payment 
1. Log on to the BMC website mentioned above. 2. Enter your account number. There is also a search facility in case you do not remember your account number. The account number is also mentioned in your property tax bill. 3. Choose your option of payment: half-yearly or annually 4. Enter the amount to be paid. You will be directed to the payment mode. Currently only net banking is permitted. 5. After payment is made the system will generate a receipt. Print this and keep it as your record. 
Make sure that the system updates your record and no ‘outstandings’ are shown against your account. There have been errors of this nature and the onus is on you to get it corrected. 
Stanley Varghese for IndiaProperty.com
